intro: Microcos paucicostata, commonly known as the narrow-costed microcos, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, palmate leaves and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
